title: I’m sold on the Samsung Galaxy Fold, but I say skip the Flip
content:
Phone manufacturers spent most of the 2010s shrinking bezels and seeing how large a design they could get away with. Eventually, pretty much every phone on the market was just one big screen housed in a metal and glass chassis. Phones couldn’t get any larger without looking absurd. There was pretty much nowhere left to go. And so, the folding phone was born. The advent of folding displays has opened the door to all sorts of new form factors, but so far the market seems to have settled on the two designs offered by Samsung: roughly regular-sized phones that unfold…

description: The Samsung Galaxy Fold 3 feels like a mobile productivity and entertainment revolution. The Flip 3 is just a regular phone that folds.
